availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip Beyerbach (Jefferson County, Kentucky, coffee house proprietor and tavern keeper)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, coffee house proprietor and tavern keeper. Native of Germany. Married to Juliana "Julia" Beyerbach. Father of Frederica Beyerbach Hill, Herman Beyerbach, William Henry Beyerbach, Charles Beyerbach, and Hannah "Ann" Beyerbach. Resident in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1840. Coffee house proprietor in Jefferson County in 1850. Tavern keeper in Jefferson County in 1860. Died in Jefferson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, p. 129.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 449B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 3, p. 670-71.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482708, p. 157.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Jefferson County Wills, vol. 6-7, 1862-1872, p. 284.
KYR-0001-004-0448.
